comment: I loved calculus 2 because of Laval! I got A on 2 test and finals. If you go to class you will understand everything on the exam because he explains thoroughly.

He lectured straight from the slides. The tests were easy and he gave a take home final, but he was overall just a mediocre professor. He didn't seem like he enjoyed the class at all. Overall, he is an easy A, but I didn't learn as much as expected.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He is a very boring lecturer. Attendance was mandatory, but I was always falling asleep because he's so monotonous and talks quietly. He seems incredibly self-absorbed and arrogant too, so that made me not like him. I did well in his class though, it just felt like it took a hundred years to end.

One of my favorite teachers! Had him for calc 2 and calc 3. My only regrets are that I didn't find him sooner and that I can't take any more classes with him. Don't get me wrong, you need to put in the work, but you will come out with a better understanding. Go to class, take notes, do the homework and study and you will do well.

Honestly the best math teacher I've ever had. He is very helpful. Just go to class and take notes. Homework is very difficult and challenging. However, quizzes and test are really easy. I warn you though, missing one class day can really set you back. Make sure you take this class later in the day so you do not oversleep or skip it.

Very good professor, he actually challenges you to learn the material, not just regurgitate it.  The material is very challenging but he presents it well.  He has a french accent, but it is not hard to understand him.  Does not use the textbook at all.

He's ok. I'm a math major, so its not a matter of the work. He explains in over-technical terms (he writes for textbooks & it shows) & he won't help you if he thinks youre not trying hard enough (he sent me away saying "review calc1"). He basically just reads his notes in class. He's not terrible, but not good either. Meh.

Laval is a Frenchman and I couldn't help but want him to say Ricky Bobby. Other than that, Laval is very smart, and runs a tight class. He won't make you do anything, but is open for help and questions. If you take competent notes, go to class, use his study guide and study it in depth before the test, you will do fine. I received a B.

i definitely felt like i was in an english class.  he explained everything and had a proof for everything which made it really hard to understand the basic calculus concepts.  im not a math major so if you are, you might would want to take his class.  his grading however is awesome.  he gives lots of credit and is helpful outside of class.

I felt like if I was in an English class. I probally written more in this class than my english classes combined. He is not clear on what he wants and expect you to explain every problem you do with words. I consider myself a math person but had difficulty with him and his teaching style.
he's a smart guy..made me luv math n nw i have it as my minor

Do all the hw and understand it (go to math lab for help).  His tests are based off the exams, and so if you can do the harder probs on the hw you will ace the tests.  He is very honest, straight forward, professional, and runs a well scheduled class.  Good calc prof.

If you work full-time, have more than one class and not a math major then avoid him. Lot of homework, does not post the solutions. Don't bother asking question in class, he doesn't like it, he pretty much re-write online notes in the board, word by word and explanations are not clear, don't buy the book. Nice guy, math majors will love him.

If anyone is continuing math education past calc I then I highly recommend Laval. He makes sure he uses baby powder when he changes your diaper. (Online notes in detail, online solutions to every quiz/test/graded homework.) He even extended his office hours when he saw the Test 2 grades were lower than the first. That says alot about someone

If you're not a math major run from him!--lot of homework,  Test based on pure homework and out of nowhere questions from his notes (don't buy the book!)Damn if you ask questions and Damn if you don't but if you have questions ask at his office. answer all the homework questions (all!) and pray you'll remember them during test!

Dr Laval is a nice guy do not get me wrong.  He is not very clear on want he wants, EVER.  He wants you to do all of the homework, which I do recommend.  BUT  the homework is NOTHING at all like his (2) test. The quizzes are horrible.And he doesnt want to take time to help you understand.I had a question about a problem and he told metofigure it my

This guy is horrible. I plead with you not to take him. He never answers questions his quizzes have nothing to do twith anything he lectured about and he love to annoy you when you dare to ask questions. gust stay at all possible cost.

Prof Laval was a great teacher. He was very easy and had only 2 tests, a final, and one project. The class itself is hard and you have to work at it, but he is very good that you understand most things. He is not very helpful when it comes to visiting after class: he will kick you out if he gets a call or another student is waiting! Good overall:)
He needs to speak louder and write examples that he actually uses in the test and quizzes. He does not clarify things as well as he should. Many people in my class failed.

from the get-go Laval made his expectations of 4381 students clear. he flies through material, so in class i felt that his explanations were quite terse. when i visited him during office hours or emailed him, this is where he would take the time to go through things with a fine tooth comb. he is a fair grader & i would take 4382 if it wasnt so late
This was an extremely difficult course. Dr. Laval did a good job at making it understandable. If you work hard, you'll do well in his class

I felt like I was writing a novel on math in his class. Notes were in words rather than #s & were unclear. Difficult to ask him questions and get clear responses. ONLY 2 test grades and some POP quizzes for your grade. NOT recommended unless you are a math WIZ!

AWESOME PROF! Make sure you pay attention in class and start preparing in time to study the large amounts of material on the tests. He is a nice guy, very understanding, and willing to help. You show interest in passing and he'll do whatever he can to help you, with in limits of course.
teachers foriegn so hard to understand and his tests are pritty hard but dont slack at end of semester and youll be alright

How you do in this calss depends on which class you're taking. Calc 3 had no projects.  You had to do the homework to do well in the class and ask questions. Go see him if you need help, he will remember that you're trying hard and give you a better grade if you're on the edge. Very soft spoken so sit up front. Not many grades given.
I didn't do well in the class, but I did learn a lot.  He posts notes on the web which helps.  My grade was a reflection on my personal prep. for the class.  He is easy to look at, though.

Very soft-spoken; don't sit in the back if you like hearing. His classes are unbelievably boring; he does try to joke to lighten things up. He puts PDFs of his notes online, then simply compies them onto the board in class. Doesn't like solving hmwk problems. One project--by yourself or in groups, fairly simple as long as you don't procrastinate.
Very Hard, but can be very helpful if you have time to go see him.  I had a rough time pulling off a C and I consider myself a math person.
Became frustrated when asked questions, had many helpfull study tools, expected too much.
Very good Prof.  He'll help you out and is very clear in his teaching.

this is perhaps the greatest teacher I have ever had. He really wants the students to know the material, and is very helpful!! Best math teacher ever, excellent notes and explanations to help you learn. His quizzes/notes really prepare you for the test.

OUTSTANDING professor.  His notes were detailed and indepth.  His class lectures were taught in the same manner.  Gave about 5 quizzes, 2 exams, plus the final.  All tests were fairly written and graded.  I'm so glad that I found him.
He is very helpful. His tests were easy. overall, he is a great teacher. Take him if you are good in math. you will be happy!
Difficult teacher, but teaches the subject well. His tests are fairly simple if you do your homework and understand the material well.
